comment: She's a sweet women

I took this class online and I have never regretted anything more. The material we were told to study was nowhere near what was on the tests/quizzes. Instead of understanding and being accommodating, she was accusatory, rude, and dismissive! Every week, something went wrong. If this class had been taught by anyone else, it would have been great.

Professor Ikegwuonu is a very nice woman. Often times, she goes off on irrelevant spiels and forgets what she's lecturing about. The book is trivial as long as you take good lecture notes. I gave her a 4 for difficulty because the tests sometimes do not follow the lectures making them hard. There''s one 10-page research paper, worth 35%.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: 2nd time taking her and will take again if I can! She is on top of keeping the class informed of everything via email. Great, detailed feedback on grades. I took her online this time and it was a fair amount of work that helps keep your grade up. Weekly discussion posts and quizzes teach you the matieral well. Easy class to pass and very fair&nice

I CAN'T STAND THIS WOMAN!  Literally have been in her class for a week and regretting it so much already.  She is super rude and condescending.  She gets frustrated by questions and has the same blanket response for everything.  Its going to be a LONG semester.

Class consist of attendance, pop quizzes/in class activities, 4 tests (drops the lowest), and assignments. Assignments are written and are short. Beware of pop quizzes though. The first test was online at home, the second test was in class with no use of notes or the book, the third exam was in class with notes, and the fourth was online . Got an A
rating_tags: BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria

comment: Professor Ikegwuonu is a very smart lady, who is very passionate about what she teaches. She gives good feedback and is always emailing the class. However she has no idea how to use technology and she forgets to give you assignments until the last two weeks of class. Other than never knowing when you have work, the work she gives is east.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: The class always acts like theyre always mad with her and she doesn't have a great rating- but I don't get it. She is respectful, very intelligent, always responds to emails, etc promptly. Few assignments and 3-4 tests, nothing too difficult. Pop quizzes, again nothing too bad. Off topic and rambles often, but not a big deal. Shes act. very sweet!
rating_tags: Respected--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: She is an amazing teacher and very intelligent. Her class is fairly easy and the syllabus is clear about everything. She does tend to go off topic from time to time, and sometimes speed through her PowerPoint, which she does not post on D2L. You have to take notes as well.

I am a criminology major so this course was very important for me. Our first test was supposed to be over 3 chapters and was only over 1 because she got so off topic while lecturing. She is not very organized and poor at communicating with students (especially during finals week). I have never been this unhappy with a teacher.

Super sweet and passionate. She very obviously cares about her students. Lectures are usually interesting, but she strays off topic very easily. Not very much actually material was covered in the class because she gets off topic so easily. The class was enjoyable and I still learned a lot from her, even if not all of it was from the textbook. TAKE!

I took this class online and the requirements for the course were incredibly clear from day one. Four assignments due a week, for each chapter, none of which were horribly difficult. Read the chapter, do the assignments, and you should be fine. Professor responds to emails promptly provided the answer hasn't already been answered prior. Easy class.

Could not even ask questions because she talked the entire class period. If you tried to ask something she would shush you. Infamous for going on tangents that do not even relate to the material. She crammed 6 assignments in the end of the semester because she used up all the time talking about irrelevant topics. I would not recommend taking her.
Easy A as long as you ready and do assignments. I took online class and it is basically self taught material

She  rambles about things that are not even remotely relevant to the class. she also gives A LOT of pop quizzes about material we have not discussed yet. her power points are vague and doesnt put them up online and what she talks about is not what the power point says. i get As in all criminal justice classes that ive taken but her class i got a C

A lot of work; discussions, quizzes, and assignments every week! She posts a grading scale so that you know how to answer discussions & assignments. 4 test total including 1 final. Not too hard; very long! She posts a lot of material to help you do the work and book is FREE! Responds to email in a fair manner. Not a hard class, just put in effort!
I liked her, realtime experience and genuine.

She's very fair and Cengage was messing up the portion of the class by marking incorrect answers and the assignments every week are 1-2 pages and she grades them very easily. TestsQuizzes were easy online with exam 4 optional (final).  I respect her for her effort and she is a good person to get to know on an individual level! Easy AB course!

I really enjoyed this class and I really liked this professor. There were huge technical issues with the learning software we were using - the computer marked correct answers as wrong, but Dr. Ikegwuonu went above and beyond to make sure that everyone got the grades they deserved and showed a lot of leeway. Very passionate and knowledgable.

Very passionate about her course, was a lawyer for years so she knows what she is talking about. Attendance is 30 percent so if you go to class it helps out your grade a lot. If you don't want to go to class don't take her. The only downside is she is not good with technology so she needs some reminders about that, but she is very fair.

I LOVED this online course. The e-book for the class was free and extremely useful! Easy assignments and discussions. Tests are easy. Everything is straight to the point! Only thing is, you have to teach yourself the material.... Or use the book for everything. :) 10 questions for quizzes, 40-45 for exams. Would take it again! (If i had to)

Very nice lady. Class wasn't too awful. But she talks a LOT. Her lectures take up the full class period, we never get out early. She's willing to help in any way she can, and is always willing to talk to students. Attendance is taken everyday. Quizzes, tests, attendance, a few 1-2 page assignments make up the grading. But she knows her stuff.

Had a horrible issue with Cengage this semester, and she won't be using it again, but is very disorganized, defensive, and long-winded. Easy to manipulate but difficult to sit through her lectures. She's so disorganized that your grade is more chance than based on your performance. Knowledgeable but I learned very little. No class participation.

I took this class in Fall of 2013 and received an "A" for the course. The work wasn't hard. No class assignments that I can remember but all tests were based off the lecture (i.e. powerpoint slides). I studied and did vocabulary and aced her class. Have taken her before so I knew what I was getting myself into. I enjoyed taking her both times.

She is a very smart professor. She is teaching from a law perspective so it is different from most other professors I have taken. She has her degree in law which makes her teach the class differently than I expected. She is disorganized sometimes, but she does genuinely want the best for her students. Text book is used more for personal use.
very knowledgeable, needs to make the class more interactive though,read her slides and you'll do okay on the tests

Very knowledgeable. She teaches, cannot asked questions( which is the basis for true learning). No too organized, grading papers takes 3 weeks. Changed test date on day of test. Much respect but terrible experience.

She is not the worst professor I had this semester. I didn't see her as very rude, however, she does talk a lot and sometimes I wasn't sure if she was just talking to herself. If you go to class and listen you can get a good grade.

She is a good professor, just attend her class and write notes, study her powerpoint slides plus the note and you do fine in the test. She offer extra credits. 4 tests which are 25 multiplying questions and the final, and you can drop the lowest score. I didn't study that hard and I got B

She loves to hear herself talk. Spends most of the class talking about herself and her own accomplishments. She will present an idea and elaborate beyond what is necessary, to the point that each idea takes 10 minutes to explain because she just wants to hear herself talk. Don't take her if you get annoyed easily.

Easy class if you go. Read textbook chapters prior to testing. Only 25 easy multiple choice questions. Not the most entertaining class nor is she the best professor, but easy A and sometimes releases class early.

Lecture class, gets off topic a lot. There's only five tests, usually 25 multiple choice. She knows her material but gets off topic often, test notes can be frustrating because she will only use maybe 50% of her lecture. If there is no other professor available, don't take this course.
grade based of 5 test and attendance, so yes ATTENDANCE is MANDATORY. material is interesting, not so much the class. go to class and you should do fine
She is an awesome professor, who is well educated. If you don't like her don't take her class. I promise at the end of the day she will be just fine. I enjoy her teaching and her lectures.
Talks more about herself but the classwork wasn't hard but the class wasn't that easy either.

The worst professor you will ever meet Kennesaw hired her so that says alot about her. The issue I have with her is that she always tries to inhabit students intentionally, telling us things at the last minute, cancel classes frequently, and she is rude as hell. If you like to be treated as an adult don't take this class

Avoid her. By far the worst professor I've ever had. Extremely rude. A student asked how to spell a word and she got sassy with him and wouldn't spell it also she made a rude comment about being afraid of Muslims during the middle of class. She should not be a professor

Dr. Ikegwuonu does come off arrogant, and spends a lot of time talking about herself and her accomplishments, but after 2 weeks she grew on me. Her test are EASY! Always multiple choice, she DOES NOT do short answer, essay, fill in the blank or none of that crap other professors make you do. She always responds to emails shockingly fast! Love her!

I was in this class all of one day before dropping it immediately. She is arrogant and spent the entire time belittling students, just INTRODUCING the class. She went on to state that "the grass isn't always greener on the other side". It is. I suggest highly that you avoid her.
Absolutely could not stand taking her class. She is incredibly rude towards her students and loves to get off subject. Her powerpoints are boring and useless. Avoid her.

Her course is very easy. All you have to do is attend class, read the book, answer simple questions for homework, do a short paper, and take the tests, which she lets you use your notes for. She also gives you the oppurtunity to get feedback on the tests after she gives them back. Her delivery can be confusing; she tells you what will be on test. 6

She is terrible at teaching. She was the most unorganized professor I have ever dealt with. Our class did not follow the schedule that was listed in the syllabus. I had to make up a test because I had the flu and I had to wait on her for almost an hour because she was not in her office at the time she told me to come.

I have never been in a classroom that was this disorganized. She knows the material, but has no idea how to teach. She is condescending to anyone who tries to talk to her, and her lectures are 10 minutes worth of material surrounded by an hour of her telling the class how smart she is.

She is completely unorganized and she has a tendency to rant about things unrelated to the class. This eats up the class time so that she doesn't have to teach you. Also, she has no idea what kind of assignments she's going to give until the minute she gives them. Most of the class was just made up as we went along.

AWFUL. absolutely terrible class. the worst part is that it's mandatory so you have to listen to her. i WAS interested in criminal justice until i had her and she ruined it for me. avoid her and take another intro. teacher. do yourself a favor.

Avoid this professor! The class was not the worst in the world but I definitely wouldn't recommend taking it with her. Class is mandatory, and she spends most of the lecture time bragging about her experience and going over her expectations for the students. Just avoid taking her and save yourself a headache.

Absolutely horrible. Most of the time class was taken up by her pointless stories, then she expected us to go home and understand two whole chapters for a test the following class. Very unreliable and rude to her students. Doesn't relate well AT ALL.

Not recommended but decent. She does know the material but seems to have problems relating to students. Lectures are mandatory however half of the lecture is spent either talking about herself or things that don't relate to class material. Doesn't believe in test review so plan on doing lots of reading with minimal direction towards exam material.

Professor does talk a lot during the 1st few weeks of class, but it does usually pick up. Very knowledgable about the subject and approachable. The book is a must and so is class attendance. Overall I thoroughly enjoyed the class and would take her again.

RUN AWAY. Do not take this professor, if you can even call her that. She is condescending and talks down to the students. She treats us like first graders and spends class time making up information or bragging about her qualifications. She is an attorney but is teaching Police in America and doesn't know the laws. She is horrible. AVOID.

Do not take her. She is very rude, will not stop to explain if you do not understand, and talks way too fast to take notes. She is very knowledgeable but does not know how to teach, yet every day she brags about how qualified she is and how long she has been a professor. Avoid.
Worst teacher possible. Gives busy work all the time and expects you to write half a page  on a simple question. Rude, arrogant, and a terrible overall class.

Run. Rude and condescending to students, pointless meandering lectures and ridiculous exams. Unapproachable for help and belittles those who ask questions in class. Will make you lose interest in CJ, law, etc.  This is the 1st course I've ever had to withdraw from. Also, prof misuses "literally" about 20 times per class period.
